member.name: M:WW.Math.Geometry.Ray2D.GetIntersectionCoefficients(WW.Math.Geometry.Ray2D,WW.Math.Geometry.Segment2D,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Calculate intersection point between a ray and a segment.
member.param: p (may note be smaller than zero). When the ray and segment are parallel, then p is set to .
q has value between 0 and 1 when there is 1 intersection. When the ray and segment are parallel, then p is set to .
is set to true when the line and segment are parallel.
member.returns: whether the ray and segment intersect.
member.remarks: The results is the solution of equation .Origin + p * .Direction = .Start + q * .GetDelta().

is set to true when the ray and segment are parallel.
member.returns: whether the line and segment intersect.
member.remarks: The results is the solution of equation .Origin + p * .Direction = .Start + q * .GetDelta().

member.name: M:WW.Math.Geometry.GeneralShape2D.Fixate
member.summary: Set this shape into fixed state.
member.remarks: In fixed state it is no longer possible to change this shape, which allows for optimizations for iterators. Therefore it's a good idea to set shapes to fixed when it is clear that they are no longer changed. There is no way to "unfixate" a once fixed shape other then to append it to another .

member.name: M:WW.Math.Geometry.GeneralShape2D.ShrinkWrap
member.summary: Shrink this shape, then set it into fixed state.
member.remarks: Calling this method is a good idea for longer living shapes after they are constructed.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2BR
member.summary: 2D triangulator that can triangulate polygons with holes.

remarks.para: The polygons may not cross each other.
The algorithm used is a Constrained Delaunay triangulation.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2BR.Triangulate(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Point2BR}},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2BR.Triangle},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Point2BR})
member.summary: Triangulates given polygons and returns triangles and points.
member.param: Input. The polygons may not cross each other.
Output triangles, only contains the triangle point indices.
Output points, referred to by the point indices in the output triangles.

remarks.para: The polygons may not cross each other.
The algorithm used is a Constrained Delaunay triangulation.

member.example:
Below is an example demonstrating triangulating a square polygon with a hole in it. The hole is a smaller square.
This is the output of the triangulation:
(-2, 2), (1, 1), (-1, 1)
(-1, -1), (-2, 2), (-1, 1)
(1, 1), (2, 2), (1, -1)
(-2, 2), (2, 2), (1, 1)
(2, -2), (-1, -1), (1, -1)
(2, 2), (2, -2), (1, -1)
(-1, -1), (-2, -2), (-2, 2)
(2, -2), (-2, -2), (-1, -1)

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2BR.Triangulate(System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Point2BR},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Int32}},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2BR.Triangle})
member.summary: Triangulates given point set and polylines.
member.param: Represents polylines of fixed edges. May be empty or null. Each integer is an index in the inputPoints.

remarks.para: The polygons may not cross each other.
The algorithm used is a Constrained Delaunay triangulation.
This method may skip points that are very close together, in that case also the point index lists are modified.

member.example:
Below is an example demonstrating triangulating five points resulting in three triangles. The second triangulation is the same as the first one, but with one edge fixed (which forces more skinny triangles in this particular case).
This is the output of the first triangulation:
(2, 2), (-2, -2), (-2, 2)
(2, 2), (4, 0), (2, -2)
(2, -2), (-2, -2), (2, 2)
This is the output of the second triangulation:
(-2, -2), (4, 0), (2, -2)
(4, 0), (-2, -2), (2, 2)
(2, 2), (-2, -2), (-2, 2)

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2BR.Triangulate(System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Point2BR},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Int32}},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2BR.Triangle},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Triangulates given point set and polylines.
member.param: Represents polylines of fixed edges. May be empty or null. Each integer is an index in the inputPoints.
if set to true removes super triangles when finished triangulating.

remarks.para: The polygons may not cross each other.
The algorithm used is a Constrained Delaunay triangulation.
This method may skip points that are very close together, in that case also the point index lists are modified.

member.summary: Replace this triangle by 3 new triangles.
Replace this triangle by 3 new triangles.

Creates 2 triangles such of the new triangles 2 of the 3 edges remain at the same index. The sweep triangle point always remains at index 0. The 2 triangles are created in clockwise order along the divided edge.

member.name: P:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2BR.Triangle.Edge0HasOddFixCount
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether edge 0 has an odd fix count, i.e. if 3 then edge 0 was fixed 3 times, this could happen when 3 polylines run over this edge. Depending on the definition of inside/outside, when odd, the edge is a transition from inside to outside, when even, both sides are either inside/outside.

member.name: P:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2BR.Triangle.Edge1HasOddFixCount
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether edge 1 has an odd fix count, i.e. if 3 then edge 0 was fixed 3 times, this could happen when 3 polylines run over this edge. Depending on the definition of inside/outside, when odd, the edge is a transition from inside to outside, when even, both sides are either inside/outside.

member.name: P:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2BR.Triangle.Edge2HasOddFixCount
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether edge 2 has an odd fix count, i.e. if 3 then edge 0 was fixed 3 times, this could happen when 3 polylines run over this edge. Depending on the definition of inside/outside, when odd, the edge is a transition from inside to outside, when even, both sides are either inside/outside.

member.summary: Returns whether p is contained in the triangle specified by p0, p1, p2.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangle2BR.ContainsPoint(WW.Math.Exact.Point2BR,WW.Math.Exact.Point2BR,WW.Math.Exact.Point2BR,WW.Math.Exact.Point2BR,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns whether p is contained in the triangle specified by p0, p1, p2.
member.param: Index of edge to skip checking (e.g. if it was already checked elsewhere). Pass 0-2 to skip check a certain edge, or -1 to check all edges.
The on edge flags (only valid when return value is true): 0 is not on an edge, 1 is on the edge starting at p0, 2 is on the edge starting at p1, 4 is on the edge starting at p2.
Index of the edge (between 0 and 2) outside which the point is if the result is false, -1 otherwise.
member.returns: true if the specified p contains point; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The triangle points must be in clockwise order!

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Ray2LR
member.summary: A 2D long rational () based ray consisting of a and a .
member.remarks:
The ray is represented by x(t) = + t * where t may have any value.
If used as a shape the ray is the representation of the parameter interval [0,1].

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Ray2LR.#ctor(WW.Math.Exact.Point2LR,WW.Math.Exact.Vector2LR)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Ray2LR.Intersects(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Ray2LR,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.Point2LR}@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Calculates if 2 lines intersect.
member.param: Resulting intersection if there is one, null otherwise.
If lines intersect, then this parameter indicates whether the lines are parallel. In this case parameter intersection contains no valid value.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Ray2LR.GetIntersectionCoefficients(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Ray2LR,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Ray2LR,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.LongRational}@,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.LongRational}@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Calculate intersection parameters between two lines.
member.param: p, is null if there is no intersection or if the lines are parallel or if a has a zero direction.
q, is null if there is no intersection or if the lines are parallel or if b has a zero direction.
Whether the two lines are parallel.
member.returns: whether the two lines intersect.
member.remarks: The results is the solution of equation .Origin + p * .Direction = .Origin + q * .Direction.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Ray2LR.Intersects(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Ray2LR,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Segment2LR)
member.summary: Calculate intersection point between a ray and a segment.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Ray2LR.GetIntersectionCoefficients(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Ray2LR,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Segment2LR,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.LongRational}@,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.LongRational}@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Calculate intersection point between a ray and a segment.
member.param: p has value between 0 and 1 when there is 1 intersection. When the ray and segment are parallel or if a has a zero direction, then p is set to null.
q has value between 0 and 1 when there is 1 intersection. When the ray and segment are parallel or if b has a zero length, then q is set to null.
is set to true when the ray and segment are parallel.
member.returns: whether the ray and segment intersect.
member.remarks: The results is the solution of equation .Origin + p * .Direction = .Start + q * .GetDelta().

member.name: M:WW.Collections.Generic.BinaryHeap`1.Build(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{`0})
member.summary: Builds the heap using specified values. This is more efficient than adding the values one by one using (O(N) versus O(N lg N) time).
member.remarks: The method is most efficient when adding values to an empty heap, but it may also be called on non-empty heaps. The more elements were already present in the heap, the more time it costs reordering all the elements in the right order.

member.summary: 1 = left, 2 = right.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Geometry.VattiClipper2DV3.Edge.MarkInBetween(WW.Math.Geometry.VattiClipper2DV3.ScanBeam)
member.summary:
When all edges going through a point are collected and ordered clockwise, one edge (pair) crosses an other when there is exactly one edge of one pair in between the 2 edges of the edge pair. Note that a straight edge not having a vertex at this point is treated as 2 edges with a shared vertex at this point.
Crossing of edge pairs a and b at + sign:
a b a b bbbb+ a a
Not crossing of edge pairs a and b (only touching at + sign):
a b a b +bbbbbbbbbb a a

member.summary: Quick check a shape for clipping.
member.param: The clipper that performs the clipping internally.
the epsilon accuracy used for flattening shapes into polylines in the context of bounds calculation.
member.returns: The result of checking the shape for clipping.
member.remarks: This is performing the whole clipping process without performing the actual clipping, so in most cases this is useless. But in some circumstances like outputting text as text this method is useful to check whether a given text is clipped.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR
member.summary: This class represents a 2D polygon: a closed plane figure with n sides (in 2D).
member.remarks:
This class has methods to:
calculate the polygon area (),
to test whether a point is inside the polygon (),
test whether the polygon is clockwise or not (),
do boolean operations (, , ).
Further static methods are also provided to allow to use other data structures than Polygon2BR.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR.GetIntersection(System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR})
member.summary: Get the intersection of two given regions.

remarks.para: Each region is defined by a set of polygons. If a polygon is counter clockwise, it is filled, if it's clockwise it represents a hole. Polygons of one region may not intersect each other. A polygon may touch itself though.
The outer polygon must always be counter clockwise (if there are holes, the hole must always be a cutout of a non-hole).

member.returns: The polygons building the intersection of both lists.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR.GetDifference(System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR})
member.summary: Get the difference of two given regions (region2 is subtracted from region1).

remarks.para: Each region is defined by a set of polygons. If a polygon is counter clockwise, it is filled, if it's clockwise it represents a hole. Polygons of one region may not intersect each other. A polygon may touch itself though.
The outer polygon must always be counter clockwise (if there are holes, the hole must always be a cutout of a non-hole).

member.returns: The polygons building the difference of the first minus the second list.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR.GetUnion(System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR})
member.summary: Get the union of two given regions.

remarks.para: Each region is defined by a set of polygons. If a polygon is counter clockwise, it is filled, if it's clockwise it represents a hole. Polygons of one region may not intersect each other. A polygon may touch itself though.
The outer polygon must always be counter clockwise (if there are holes, the hole must always be a cutout of a non-hole).

member.returns: The polygons building the union of the first and the second region.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR.GetExclusiveOr(System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR})
member.summary: Get the exclusive or (XOR) of two given regions.

remarks.para: Each region is defined by a set of polygons. If a polygon is counter clockwise, it is filled, if it's clockwise it represents a hole. Polygons of one region may not intersect each other. A polygon may touch itself though.
The outer polygon must always be counter clockwise (if there are holes, the hole must always be a cutout of a non-hole).

member.returns: The polygons building the exclusive or of the first and the second region.

member.summary: Calculates the convex hull using the Melkman algorithm (1987). This method assumes the specified polygon is a simple polygon (i.e. it does not cross itself).
member.remarks: The running time of this algorithm is O(n).

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR.GetConvexHull(System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Point2BR})
member.summary: Calculates the convex hull using the Melkman algorithm (1987). This method assumes the specified polygon is a simple polygon (i.e. it does not cross itself). The input polygon is expected to be counter clockwise. The result is counter clockwise.
member.remarks: The running time of this algorithm is O(n).

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR.BooleanOperations
member.summary: This class contains methods for doing boolean operations on 2D polygons.

remarks.para:
The following boolan operations are implemented:
Union:
Difference:
Intersection:
Exclusive or (symmetric difference):

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR.BooleanOperations.GetUnion(System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR})
member.summary: Get the union of two given regions.

remarks.para: Each region is defined by a set of polygons. If a polygon is counter clockwise, it is filled, if it's clockwise it represents a hole. Polygons of one region may not intersect each other. A polygon may touch itself though.
The outer polygon must always be counter clockwise (if there are holes, the hole must always be a cutout of a non-hole).

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR.BooleanOperations.GetDifference(System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR})
member.summary: Get the difference of two given regions (region2 is subtracted from region1).

remarks.para: Each region is defined by a set of polygons. If a polygon is counter clockwise, it is filled, if it's clockwise it represents a hole. Polygons of one region may not intersect each other. A polygon may touch itself though.
The outer polygon must always be counter clockwise (if there are holes, the hole must always be a cutout of a non-hole).

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR.BooleanOperations.GetIntersection(System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR})
member.summary: Get the intersection of two given regions.

remarks.para: Each region is defined by a set of polygons. If a polygon is counter clockwise, it is filled, if it's clockwise it represents a hole. Polygons of one region may not intersect each other. A polygon may touch itself though.
The outer polygon must always be counter clockwise (if there are holes, the hole must always be a cutout of a non-hole).

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR.BooleanOperations.GetExclusiveOr(System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR})
member.summary: Get the exclusive or (XOR) of two given regions.

remarks.para: Each region is defined by a set of polygons. If a polygon is counter clockwise, it is filled, if it's clockwise it represents a hole. Polygons of one region may not intersect each other. A polygon may touch itself though.
The outer polygon must always be counter clockwise (if there are holes, the hole must always be a cutout of a non-hole).

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2BR.BooleanOperations.SweepLine
member.summary: Loosely based on bentley-ottman and "line segment intersection" by M. de Berg et al. TODO: Remark from the double-precision implementation of this algorithm: However this implementation doesn't use a balanced search tree for ordering segments along the sweepline as it would be difficult to circumvent precision issues in case of multiple overlapping line segments. For big rationals there are no precision issues, so can implement this more accurately.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2LR.Intersects(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2LR,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.Point2LR}@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Calculates if 2 lines intersect.
member.param: Resulting intersection if there is one, null otherwise.
If lines intersect, then this parameter indicates whether the lines are parallel. In this case parameter intersection contains no valid value.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2LR.GetIntersectionCoefficients(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2LR,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2LR,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.LongRational}@,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.LongRational}@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Calculate intersection parameters between two lines.
member.param: p, is null if there is no intersection or if the lines are parallel or if a has a zero direction.
q, is null if there is no intersection or if the lines are parallel or if b has a zero direction.
Whether the two lines are parallel.
member.returns: whether the two lines intersect.
member.remarks: The results is the solution of equation .Origin + p * .Direction = .Origin + q * .Direction.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2LR.Intersects(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2LR,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Segment2LR)
member.summary: Calculate intersection point between a line and a segment.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2LR.GetIntersectionCoefficients(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2LR,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Segment2LR,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.LongRational}@,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.LongRational}@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Calculate intersection point between a line and a segment.
member.param: p has value between 0 and 1 when there is 1 intersection. When the line and segment are parallel or if a has a zero direction, then p is set to null.
q has value between 0 and 1 when there is 1 intersection. When the line and segment are parallel or if b has a zero length, then q is set to null.
is set to true when the line and segment are parallel.
member.returns: whether the line and segment intersect.
member.remarks: The results is the solution of equation .Origin + p * .Direction = .Start + q * .GetDelta().

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.VattiPolylineClipper2D.EventQueue
member.summary: The event queue is the scan beam table (SBT) in the article. This is an ordered list of events ordered by their y-coordinate. Deviating slightly from the article here where only the y-coordinate is stored. Might as well store the actual event that is associated with the y-coordinate to save the cost of looking for it.

member.summary: Pop the event on the top of the queue.

member.summary: TODO: could embed this into id for better performance in the future.

member.summary: The success of this edge will be added to the active edge list.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Geometry.VattiPolylineClipper2D.ScanBeam.ProcessIntersections
member.summary: When updating the xBottom scan line intersection, the edges are out of order. The edges have to be swapped to order them again, and each swap marks an intersection.

member.summary: If the edge doesn't have a side yet, assign one based on the parity of edges of the same type. Also calculate if the edge contributes to an output polygon.
member.param: Whether the number of edges of the same type as the input edge to the left of the input edge is odd. When 2 edges are of the same type, they are called like edges in the article.
Whether the number of edges of different type as the input edge to the left of the input edge is odd. When 2 edges are of different type, they are called unlike edges in the article.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.VattiPolylineClipper2D.HorizontalEvent
member.summary: A base class for dealing with horizontal events on the scanline itself. This is intended to make it easier to correctly handle tricky scenarios for (self)overlapping horizontal segments. At each horizontal event 2 edges are involved, connecting to their shared vertex. In case of an edge passing through the scanline, edge1 and edge2 are the same edge. Both edge1 and edge2 can be horizontal.

member.summary: Intermediate: edge1 ends, edge2 starts.

member.summary: Both edges end.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.Fixed.UnderOne
member.summary: Point is inside if real y is smaller than or equal to 1.
member.remarks: Intersection plane is defined by (0, -1, 0, 1). In Blinn terminology: boundary coordinate for point (x, y, z, w) is w - y.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.Fixed.AboveZero
member.summary: Point is inside if real y is greater than or equal to 0.
member.remarks: Intersection plane is defined by (0, 1, 0, 0). In Blinn terminology: boundary coordinate for point (x, y, z, w) is y.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.Fixed.LeftOfOne
member.summary: Point is inside if real x is smaller than or equal to 1.
member.remarks: Intersection plane is defined by (-1, 0, 0, 1). In Blinn terminology: boundary coordinate for point (x, y, z, w) is w - position.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.Fixed.RightOfZero
member.summary: Point is inside if real x is greater than or equal to 0.
member.remarks: Intersection plane is defined by (1, 0, 0, 0). In Blinn terminology: boundary coordinate for point (x, y, z, w) is position.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.Fixed.InFrontOfZero
member.summary: Point is inside if real z is greater than or equal to 0.
member.remarks: Intersection plane is defined by (0, 0, 1, 0). In Blinn terminology: boundary coordinate for point (x, y, z, w) is z.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.Fixed.AtBackOfOne
member.summary: Point is inside if real z is smaller than or equal to 1.
member.remarks: Intersection plane is defined by (0, 0, -1, 1). In Blinn terminology: boundary coordinate for point (x, y, z, w) is w - z.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.Generic.Under
member.summary: Point is inside if real y is smaller than or equal to top.
member.remarks: Intersection plane is defined by (0, -1, 0, top). In Blinn terminology: boundary coordinate for point (x, y, z, w) is top * w - y.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.Generic.Above
member.summary: Point is inside if real y is greater than or equal to bottom.
member.remarks: Intersection plane is defined by (0, -1, 0, bottom). In Blinn terminology: boundary coordinate for point (x, y, z, w) is bottom * w - y.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.Generic.LeftOf
member.summary: Point is inside if real x is smaller than or equal to right.
member.remarks: Intersection plane is defined by (-1, 0, 0, right). In Blinn terminology: boundary coordinate for point (x, y, z, w) is right * w - position.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.Generic.RightOf
member.summary: Point is inside if real x is greater than or equal to left.
member.remarks: Intersection plane is defined by (-1, 0, 0, left). In Blinn terminology: boundary coordinate for point (x, y, z, w) is left * w - position.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.Generic.InFrontOf
member.summary: Point is inside if real z is greater than or equal to back.
member.remarks: Intersection plane is defined by (0, 0, -1, back). In Blinn terminology: boundary coordinate for point (x, y, z, w) is back * w - z.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.Generic.AtBackOf
member.summary: Point is inside if real z is smaller than or equal to front.
member.remarks: Intersection plane is defined by (0, 0, -1, front). In Blinn terminology: boundary coordinate for point (x, y, z, w) is front * w - z.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.ClipPipeline
member.summary: A clip pipeline.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.ClipPipeline.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: This is the fastest clipping option because clipping bounds are fixed at 0 <= Position <= 1, 0 <= Y <= 1, 0 <= Z <= 1 (in real space).

member.name: M:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.ClipPipeline.Clip(WW.Math.Geometry.Polyline4D,System.Boolean,System.Action{WW.Math.Geometry.Polyline4D})
member.summary: Clip a polyline.
member.param: Is the polyline filled during rendering?
The delegate that's called for adding a clipped polyline. The clipped polyline that is passed as an argument is reused and should not be used beyond the duration of the method call.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.ClipStepForNotFilledPolyline
member.summary: Represents a clip step for clipping a not filled polyline. These can be chained for clipping at multiple clip planes. Internally a clipped polyline instance is cached to save time on creation of polyline instances. This means that this class is not thread safe.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.ClipStepForNotFilledPolyline.#ctor(WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.IInsideTester)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.ClipStepForNotFilledPolyline.Clip(WW.Math.Geometry.Polyline4D)
member.summary: Clips the specified polyline.

member.name: P:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.ClipStepForNotFilledPolyline.InsideTester
member.summary: Gets the inside tester.

member.name: P:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.ClipStepForNotFilledPolyline.AddClippedPolyline
member.summary: Gets or sets the method that's called to add a clipped polyline. This can be used to forward the clipped polyline to the next instance.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.ClipStepForFilledPolyline
member.summary: Represents a clip step for clipping a filled (and thus closed) polyline. These can be chained for clipping at multiple clip planes. Internally a clipped polyline instance is cached to save time on creation of polyline instances. This means that this class is not thread safe.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.ClipStepForFilledPolyline.#ctor(WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.IInsideTester)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Clips the specified polyline.

member.name: P:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.ClipStepForFilledPolyline.InsideTester
member.summary: Gets the inside tester.

member.name: P:WW.Math.Geometry.BlinnClipper4D.ClipStepForFilledPolyline.AddClippedPolyline
member.summary: Gets or sets the method that's called to add a clipped polyline. This can be used to forward the clipped polyline to the next instance.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Point3LR.op_Explicit(WW.Math.Exact.Vector4LR)~WW.Math.Exact.Point3LR
member.summary: Converts given 4D vector to a 3D point as follows: result = new Point3LR(p.X / p.W, p.Y / p.W, p.Z / p.W);
member.remarks: This conversion only works if p.W is unequal to zero. (when equal to zero the vector represents a direction).

member.name: T:WW.Drawing.Rasterizer2D
member.summary: A 2D rasterizer that rasterizes onto a bitmap, without support for alpha blending or pen width.
member.remarks: This rasterizer is in some cases faster than for those methods that are implemented and can be used to speed up drawing, which may be necessary when drawing large amounts of dots, line segments and beziers. For relatively short line segments the clipping is taking relatively much time, so there is no performance gain.

member.name: T:WW.Windows.Forms.MessageForwarder
member.summary: This class implements a filter for the Windows.Forms message pump allowing a specific message to be forwarded to the Control specified in the constructor. Adding and removing of the filter is done automatically.

remarks.para: Based on original code from cetkok: .
Add this message forwarder using . Add the forwarder e.g. when a control to which to forward messages to is entered (), and remove it again when the control is left ().

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L
member.summary: This class represents a 2D polygon: a closed plane figure with n sides (in 2D).
member.remarks:
This class has methods to:
to test whether a point is inside the polygon (),
test whether the polygon is clockwise or not (),
do boolean operations (, , ).
Further static methods are also provided to allow to use other data structures than Polygon2L.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.GetConvexHull
member.summary: Calculates the convex hull using the Melkman algorithm (1987). This method assumes the specified polygon is a simple polygon (i.e. it does not cross itself).
member.remarks: The running time of this algorithm is O(n).

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.GetConvexHull(System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Point2L})
member.summary: Calculates the convex hull using the Melkman algorithm (1987). This method assumes the specified polygon is a simple polygon (i.e. it does not cross itself). The input polygon is expected to be counter clockwise. The result is counter clockwise.
member.remarks: The running time of this algorithm is O(n).

member.name: F:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.MaxForSubdivision
member.summary: The maximum long value that can be used for coordinates that serve as input for subdivision (this is the algorithm that calculates all intersections for the polygon boolean operations). The value should be small enough so a calculated intersection (double values) compares correctly with halves.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.GetUnion(System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L})
member.summary: Get the union of two given regions.

remarks.para: Each region is defined by a set of polygons. If a polygon is counter clockwise, it is filled, if it's clockwise it represents a hole. Polygons of one region may not intersect each other. A polygon may touch itself though.
The outer polygon must always be counter clockwise (if there are holes, the hole must always be a cutout of a non-hole).

member.example: This is a simple example of getting the union of two regions.

member.param: The context object. Reuse this in subsequent polygon boolean operations.

member.summary: Removes self overlapping (opposite) segments within a region.
Collect polygon from given start segment.
member.param: the start segment of the polygon
the result region to which to add the result polygon
the function to determine whether or not to include a segment

member.summary: Subdivide the polygons in this region, in case polygons are self-intersecting. The direction of the segments in this region is ignored. Overlapping parts in the region are removed. Returns the resulting region, in which all polygons are counter clockwise.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is reversed.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.EventQueue
member.summary: Events are sorted first along the x-axis, and then along the y-axis.
member.remarks: Must be a binary search tree like , because it must be possible to check for existing intersections. Otherwise a binary heap could have been sufficient ().

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.EventQueue.Dequeue
member.summary: Dequeues the event on top of the queue.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.Event
member.summary: An event representing either a segment entering, exiting or intersecting on the sweep line.
member.remarks: Events are sorted first along the x-axis, and then along the y-axis. Entry and exit events happen at integer coordinates, intersection events happen at floating point coordinates (rounded fractions).

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.Event.Process(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SweepLine)
member.summary: Processes this event. Returns a snap rounding event when this event was successfully processed. The snap rounding event is processed in a separate sweep.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SweepLine
member.summary: Based on bentley-ottman and "line segment intersection" by M. de Berg et al. This calculates all segment intersections and performs the snapping of segments to tolerance squares in a separate sweep by making use of .

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SweepLine.SegmentComparer
member.summary: This comparer compares the segment-sweepline intersection y-coordinates, when the y-coordinates are equal, the slopes are compared. When adding a segment, the segment's intersection with the sweepline is either its start or end point, so some short cuts can be taken for better performance. Note this comparer should only be used for insertion, because insertion happens on integer coordinates where correct comparison can be done of the entry point against segment intersections at the particular x-coordinate.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEvent
member.summary: Represents a snap rounding event.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEvent.RegisterTopEdge(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEdge)
member.summary: Registers the top edge (only useful tor segment entry event).

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEvent.DoStep3(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNSweepLine,System.Collections.Generic.List{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEdge},System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform step 3 of algorithm 1, for events before position x. This method does not get called for events after x.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEvent.DoStep5a(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNSweepLine,System.Collections.Generic.List{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEdge},System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform step 5 of algorithm 1, for events exactly at position x. This method does not get called for events for other positions than x.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEvent.DoStep5b(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNSweepLine,System.Collections.Generic.List{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEdge},System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform step 5 of algorithm 1, for events exactly after position x. This method does not get called for events before x.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEvent.GetReferenceSegment(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the reference segment at the specified position, which is a segment on the active segment list on the sweep line that can be used as a starting point for scanning up/down to locate which segment is just below a horizontal tolerance square edge. This segment is preferred to be a low guess, and if null is returned, the scan starts at the last connected segment (assuming edges are connected from bottom to top). If there was no last connected segment, the scan starts at the bottom of the active segment list.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEvent.LocateEdgeInActiveSegmentList(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNSweepLine,System.Double,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEdge,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNActiveSegment@)
member.summary: Locates the edge in the active segment list.
member.param: The last connected segment to be used as reference segment when the event itself cannot provide a reference segment.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNActiveSegment
member.summary: Represents a segment that's active on the sweep line. This class is used during snap rounding.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNActiveSegment.AddIntersection(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.Context,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.Point)
member.summary: Adds an intersection at the specified point. Splits the remaining sub segment of this segment into 2. Initially the remaining sub segment is the original segment. Assumes that intersections are added in the order in which the sweep line encounters then, so it's only necessary to split the remaining sub segment every time an intersection is encountered.

member.name: P:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNActiveSegment.RemainderSubSegment
member.summary: In case there are intersections, this is the remainder sub segment that was created in the process of splitting the segment. The segment is being split either from start to end, or from end to start, depending on the orientation of the segment, due to the order of points with respect to the sweep line (sort order from left to right, bottom to top).

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEdge
member.summary: A (horizontal) edge of a tolerance square used for snap rounding. A tolerance square contains its bottom edge but not its top edge.

member.name: P:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEdge.Index
member.summary: Gets or sets the index in the edge list.

member.name: P:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEdge.IsTop
member.summary: Gets whether this is a top edge. If false this is a bottom edge.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNSweepLine
member.summary: A sweep line performing snap rounding.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNSweepLine.ProcessEventBatch(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEvent})
member.summary: Processed the event batch for events with rounded x-coordinate to the specified position. This corresponds to steps 2-6 of "Algorithm 1" at page 6 in article "Practical Segment Intersection with Finite Precision Output".

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNSweepLine.RelocateEdges(System.Collections.Generic.List{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Polygon2L.BooleanOperations.SNEdge},System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Relocates each edge by testing if the neighbouring segment is on the wrong side of the edge. If it is, then let the segment cross the segment, and add an intersection to the segment (only for top edges/downward sloping segments and bottom edges/upwards sloping segments).

member.summary: Gets the parameter (0-1), 0 represents a segments start point, 1 represents the end point.

member.summary: A context object for polygon boolean operations.

member.name: T:WW.Actions.Transaction
member.summary: A transaction consists of a group of commands that can be either committed or rolled back. The commands are executed as they are added in the method (by the interactor).

remarks.para: Commands within the transactions can be undone/redone, but when the last command was undone, the transaction is rolled back.
Consider e.g. the creation of a polyline, where the addition of each individual vertex is a command. If the user decides mid way he does not want the polyline, he can roll back the transaction.

member.summary: Gets the center of the segment.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Segment2LR.GetDelta
member.summary: Gets minus .

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Segment2LR.GetIntersectionParameters(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Segment2LR,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Segment2LR,WW.Math.Exact.LongRational[]@,WW.Math.Exact.LongRational[]@)
member.summary: Calculate intersection parameter between two line segments.
member.remarks: The result is the solution of equation .Start + p * .GetDelta = .Start + q * .GetDelta.
member.param: A single parameter has a value between LongRational.Zero and LongRational.One. If the lines are parallel, the start p and end p of the overlapping line are returned. Lowest p value is first in the array. If the lines don't intersect then null is returned.
Analogue to . When lines are parallel, q values are returned in the order that the corresponding points are with respect to the p values.
member.returns: true if intersection occurred.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Segment2LR.Intersects(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Segment2LR,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Segment2LR)
member.summary: Calculates if 2 line segment intersect.

member.summary: Returns true if given point is on the line segment.

member.summary: Returns the smallest squared distance between the line segment and specified point.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Segment2LR.GetClosestPoint(WW.Math.Exact.Point2LR)
member.summary: Returns the point on this segment that is closest to the specified point.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Segment2LR.GetNormalizedProjection(WW.Math.Exact.Point2LR)
member.summary: Gets the projection of specified point onto this segment, normalized such that the projection of the start point is 0 and of the end point is 1. Returns NaN if this segment has a zero length.
member.remarks: Returns the distance from this segment's start point in the direction of the end point, normalized to 0-1 when the point's projection falls between the start and end point.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Segment2LR.ContainsProjection(WW.Math.Exact.Point2LR)

member.name: M:WW.Math.Geometry.Segment2D.GetIntersectionParameters(WW.Math.Geometry.Segment2D,WW.Math.Geometry.Segment2D,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Calculate intersection parameter between two line segments.
member.remarks: The result is the solution of equation .Start + p * .GetDelta = .Start + q * .GetDelta.
member.param: A single parameter has a value between 0 and 1. If the lines are parallel, the start p and end p of the overlapping line are returned. Lowest p value is first in the array. If the lines don't intersect then null is returned.
Analogue to . When lines are parallel, q values are returned in the order that the corresponding points are with respect to the p values.
member.returns: true if intersection occurred.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Geometry.Segment2D.GetIntersectionParameters(WW.Math.Geometry.Segment2D,WW.Math.Geometry.Segment2D,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate intersection parameter between two line segments.
member.remarks: The result is the solution of equation .Start + p * .GetDelta = .Start + q * .GetDelta.
member.param: A single parameter has a value between 0 and 1. If the lines are parallel, the start p and end p of the overlapping line are returned. Lowest p value is first in the array. If the lines don't intersect then null is returned.
Analogue to . When lines are parallel, q values are returned in the order that the corresponding points are with respect to the p values.
The precision used to determine if segments are parallel or not.
member.returns: true if intersection occurred.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2I
member.summary: 2D triangulator that can triangulate polygons with holes. The maximum supported coordinate value is .

remarks.para: The polygons may not cross each other.
The algorithm used is a Constrained Delaunay triangulation.

member.example:
Below is an example demonstrating triangulating a square polygon with a hole in it. The hole is a smaller square.
This is the output of the triangulation:
(-2, 2), (1, 1), (-1, 1)
(-1, -1), (-2, 2), (-1, 1)
(1, 1), (2, 2), (1, -1)
(-2, 2), (2, 2), (1, 1)
(2, -2), (-1, -1), (1, -1)
(2, 2), (2, -2), (1, -1)
(-1, -1), (-2, -2), (-2, 2)
(2, -2), (-2, -2), (-1, -1)

member.name: F:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2I.MaxInt
member.summary: The maximum coordinate value that this triangulator supports.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2I.Triangulate(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Point2I}},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2I.Triangle},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Point2I})
member.summary: Triangulates given polygons and returns triangles and points.
member.param: Input. The polygons may not cross each other.
Output triangles, only contains the triangle point indices.
Output points, referred to by the point indices in the output triangles.

remarks.para: The polygons may not cross each other.
The algorithm used is a Constrained Delaunay triangulation.

member.example:
Below is an example demonstrating triangulating a square polygon with a hole in it. The hole is a smaller square.
This is the output of the triangulation:
(-2, 2), (1, 1), (-1, 1)
(-1, -1), (-2, 2), (-1, 1)
(1, 1), (2, 2), (1, -1)
(-2, 2), (2, 2), (1, 1)
(2, -2), (-1, -1), (1, -1)
(2, 2), (2, -2), (1, -1)
(-1, -1), (-2, -2), (-2, 2)
(2, -2), (-2, -2), (-1, -1)

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2I.Triangulate(System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Point2I},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Int32}},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2I.Triangle})
member.summary: Triangulates given point set and polylines.
member.param: Represents polylines of fixed edges. May be empty or null. Each integer is an index in the inputPoints.

remarks.para: The polygons may not cross each other.
The algorithm used is a Constrained Delaunay triangulation.
This method may skip points that are very close together, in that case also the point index lists are modified.

member.example:
Below is an example demonstrating triangulating five points resulting in three triangles. The second triangulation is the same as the first one, but with one edge fixed (which forces more skinny triangles in this particular case).
This is the output of the first triangulation:
(2, 2), (-2, -2), (-2, 2)
(2, 2), (4, 0), (2, -2)
(2, -2), (-2, -2), (2, 2)
This is the output of the second triangulation:
(-2, -2), (4, 0), (2, -2)
(4, 0), (-2, -2), (2, 2)
(2, 2), (-2, -2), (-2, 2)

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2I.Triangulate(System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Point2I},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Int32}},System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2I.Triangle},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Triangulates given point set and polylines.
member.param: Represents polylines of fixed edges. May be empty or null. Each integer is an index in the inputPoints.
if set to true removes super triangles when finished triangulating.

remarks.para: The polygons may not cross each other.
The algorithm used is a Constrained Delaunay triangulation.
This method may skip points that are very close together, in that case also the point index lists are modified.

member.summary: Gets polygons from the specified triangles. Assumes that the triangulation originates from possibly self-intersecting polygons. If the triangulations originates from non-closed polylines this method will give incorrect results.
member.remarks: In case of a hole polygon touching (e.g. at a single vertex) an outer polygon they are returned as separate polygons.
member.param: The points referenced by the triangles

member.summary: Replace this triangle by 3 new triangles.
Replace this triangle by 3 new triangles.

Creates 2 triangles such of the new triangles 2 of the 3 edges remain at the same index. The sweep triangle point always remains at index 0. The 2 triangles are created in clockwise order along the divided edge.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2I.Triangle.GetNextPolygonPoint(System.Int32,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2I.Triangle@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Tries to get the next polygon connecting to given edge. Tries to find the edge that bends most to the left, i.e. first the next edge in this triangle, and then subsequently the connecting edge in the triangles touching to the edge's end point in a clockwise manner.

member.name: P:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2I.Triangle.Edge0HasOddFixCount
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether edge 0 has an odd fix count, i.e. if 3 then edge 0 was fixed 3 times, this could happen when 3 polylines run over this edge. Depending on the definition of inside/outside, when odd, the edge is a transition from inside to outside, when even, both sides are either inside/outside.

member.name: P:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2I.Triangle.Edge1HasOddFixCount
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether edge 1 has an odd fix count, i.e. if 3 then edge 0 was fixed 3 times, this could happen when 3 polylines run over this edge. Depending on the definition of inside/outside, when odd, the edge is a transition from inside to outside, when even, both sides are either inside/outside.

member.name: P:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangulator2I.Triangle.Edge2HasOddFixCount
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether edge 2 has an odd fix count, i.e. if 3 then edge 0 was fixed 3 times, this could happen when 3 polylines run over this edge. Depending on the definition of inside/outside, when odd, the edge is a transition from inside to outside, when even, both sides are either inside/outside.

member.name: T:WW.IO.StreamUtil
member.summary: Contains utility methods for streaming.

member.name: M:WW.IO.StreamUtil.OpenReadOnlyStream(System.String)
member.summary: Opens a file for reading while other applications might still have the file opened for reading and writing. The regular will not open file while another application opened it for writing.

member.name: M:WW.IO.StreamUtil.Forward(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Forward all data in the source stream to the target stream. The source stream position is moved back to its original position afterwards.
member.remarks: In case the source is a or , then the forwarding is done more efficiently by directly making use of their internal byte buffers. Otherwise the forwarding is done by reading page by page into a temporary byte buffer and writing each page to the target.

member.name: M:WW.IO.StreamUtil.Forward(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Forward data of specified length in the source stream to the target stream. The source stream position is moved back to its original position afterwards.
member.remarks: In case the source is a or , then the forwarding is done more efficiently by directly making use of their internal byte buffers. Otherwise the forwarding is done by reading page by page into a temporary byte buffer and writing each page to the target.

member.name: T:WW.IO.MemoryPageCache
member.summary: This is a memory page cache. Caching can be useful in scenarios where memory pages are often allocated and released in succession to reduce the load on the garbage collector. Also time is saved because the byte array is not initialized like .NET does when allocating a new byte array.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets a page (content is uninitialized).
member.exception: Thrown when the specified page size does not match this cache's page size.

member.name: M:WW.IO.MemoryPageCache.ReleasePage(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Releases the specified page. It is added to this cache if the page's length matches this cache's page size.

member.summary: Gets or sets the page size.

member.summary: Bottom left edge. Successors may or may not be on the left side as they might cross the right bound.

member.summary: Bottom right edge. Successors may or may not be on the right side as they might cross the right bound.

member.summary: Gets or sets the next local minimum with equal or greater y-coordinate.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.VattiClipper2I.EventQueue
member.summary: The event queue is the scan beam table (SBT) in the article. This is an ordered list of events ordered by their y-coordinate. Deviating slightly from the article here where only the y-coordinate is stored. Might as well store the actual event that is associated with the y-coordinate to save the cost of looking for it.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.VattiClipper2I.EventQueue.Pop
member.summary: Pop the event on the top of the queue.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.VattiClipper2I.AddLocalMinimumEvent.AssignEdgeSideAndCalculateContributionToOutputPolygon(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.VattiClipper2I.ActiveEdge,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.VattiClipper2I.Polygon@)
member.summary: If the edge doesn't have a side yet, assign one based on the parity of edges of the same type. Also calculate if the edge contributes to an output polygon.
member.param: Whether the number of edges of the same type as the input edge to the left of the input edge is odd. When 2 edges are of the same type, they are called like edges in the article.
Whether the number of edges of different type as the input edge to the left of the input edge is odd. When 2 edges are of different type, they are called unlike edges in the article.

member.summary: The success of this edge will be added to the active edge list.

member.name: P:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.VattiClipper2I.AddEdgeSuccessorEvent.Order
member.summary: Process successor edges before new edges so the existing edges are already present on the active edge list when the new edges are introduced.

member.summary: This is the Active Edge Table (AET) in the article.

member.summary: Compares 2 edges in the active edge table based on their intersection with the bottom scan line (with coordinate y) of the scan beam.

member.summary: A polygon in which the results of clipping are recorded.

member.summary: 1 = clip polygon, 2 = subject polygon.

member.name: P:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.VattiClipper2I.Edge.Side
member.summary: 1 = left, 2 = right. According to the original article the side is based on a parity test of the number of active edges of the same before this edge.

member.summary: Calculate the intersection parameters between two line segments.
member.remarks: The result is the solution of equation .Start + p * .GetDelta = .Start + q * .GetDelta.
member.param: A single parameter has a value between 0 and 1. If the lines are parallel, the start p and end p of the overlapping line are returned. Lowest p value is first in the array. If the lines don't intersect then null is returned.
Analogue to . When lines are parallel, q values are returned in the order that the corresponding points are with respect to the p values.
member.returns: true if intersection occurred.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Ray2BR
member.summary: A 2D big rational based ray consisting of a and a .

The ray is represented by x(t) = + t * where t may have any value.
If used as a shape the ray is the representation of the parameter interval [0,1].

member.summary: Calculates if 2 lines intersect.
member.param: Resulting intersection if there is one, null otherwise.
If lines intersect, then this parameter indicates whether the lines are parallel. In this case parameter intersection contains no valid value.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Ray2BR.GetIntersectionCoefficients(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Ray2BR,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Ray2BR,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.BigRational}@,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.BigRational}@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Calculate intersection parameters between two lines.
member.param: p, is null if there is no intersection or if the lines are parallel or if a has a zero direction.
q, is null if there is no intersection or if the lines are parallel or if b has a zero direction.
Whether the two lines are parallel.
member.returns: whether the two lines intersect.
member.remarks: The results is the solution of equation .Origin + p * .Direction = .Origin + q * .Direction.

member.summary: Calculate intersection point between a ray and a segment.
member.param: p has value between 0 and 1 when there is 1 intersection. When the ray and segment are parallel or if a has a zero direction, then p is set to null.
q has value between 0 and 1 when there is 1 intersection. When the ray and segment are parallel or if b has a zero length, then q is set to null.
is set to true when the ray and segment are parallel.
member.returns: whether the ray and segment intersect.
member.remarks: The results is the solution of equation .Origin + p * .Direction = .Start + q * .GetDelta().

member.name: T:WW.IO.PagedMemoryStream
member.summary: Represents a paged memory stream that uses multiple byte array pages as an alternative for , which uses one byte array as a backing store.
member.remarks: occasionally runs out of memory because it uses a single byte array, which is harder to allocate than smaller byte array blocks.

member.summary: The default block size is 65536 bytes (64 KB).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, cloning the source chunked memory stream. The pages are shallow copied.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The source stream to read from.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Reuses the source memory stream buffer.

member.name: M:WW.IO.PagedMemoryStream.Flush
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

member.name: M:WW.IO.PagedMemoryStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.
member.exception: The stream does not support seeking, such as if the stream is constructed from a pipe or console output.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: M:WW.IO.PagedMemoryStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the length of the current stream.
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.

member.summary: If this flag is set, then the application MUST assume that this OLE object’s class identifier (CLSID) is {00020907-0000-0000-C000-000000000046}.

member.summary: This flag specifies whether this OLE object is a link.

member.name: F:WW.Windows.Ole.OdtPersist1Flags.Icon
member.summary: This flag specifies whether this OLE object is being represented by an icon.

member.name: F:WW.Windows.Ole.OdtPersist1Flags.Ole1
member.summary: This flag specifies whether this OLE object is only compatible with OLE 1. If this flag is not set, then the object is compatible with OLE 2.

member.name: F:WW.Windows.Ole.OdtPersist1Flags.Manual
member.summary: This flag specifies whether the user has requested that this OLE object only be updated in response to a user action.
member.remarks: If not set, then the user has requested that this OLE object update automatically. If is not set, then this flag is undefined and MUST be ignored.

member.name: F:WW.Windows.Ole.OdtPersist1Flags.RecomposeOnResize
member.summary: This flag specifies whether this OLE object has requested to be notified when it is resized by its container.

member.name: F:WW.Windows.Ole.OdtPersist1Flags.Ocx
member.summary: This flag specifies whether this object is an OLE control.

member.name: F:WW.Windows.Ole.OdtPersist1Flags.Stream
member.summary: Stream flag.
member.remarks: If is not set, then this bit MUST not be set. If is set, then this flag specifies whether this OLE control stores its data in a single stream instead of a storage. If this flag is set, then the data for the OLE control is in a stream called "\003OCXDATA" where \003 is the character with value 0x0003, not the string literal "\003".

member.name: F:WW.Windows.Ole.OdtPersist1Flags.ViewObject
member.summary: This flag specifies whether this OLE object supports the IViewObject interface.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Transformation4F.GetPerspectiveProjectionTransform(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the perspective transform based on given inverse tangents of the viewing frustrum angles and front clip, back clip planes.

remarks.para: The returned perspective transform is setup such that it can be used directly in OpenGL as the projection transform. The camera is positioned at the origin, looking towards the negative z-axis. The x-axis is pointing towards the right of the display, the y-axis points up.
This transformation matrix transforms coordinates within the viewing frustrum to a cube with coordinate ranges (-1, 1), which is convenient for clipping.

member.param: The cotangent of mu where mu is the angle between the z-axis (pointing towards the camera) and the line passing through the camera and the left side of the display.
The cotangent of nu where nu is the angle between the z-axis (pointing towards the camera) and the line passing through the camera and the top side of the display.
The front clip plane z-value closest to the camera (> 0).
The back clip plane z-value furthest from the camera (> 0).

member.name: M:WW.Math.Transformation4F.GetPerspectiveProjectionTransform(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the perspective projection transform based on given viewing frustrum dimensions.
member.param: The x-coordinate of the left of the viewing frustrum near face.
The x-coordinate of the right the viewing frustrum near face.
The y-coordinate of the bottom the viewing frustrum near face.
The y-coordinate of the top the viewing frustrum near face.
The front clip plane z-value closest to the camera (> 0).
The back clip plane z-value furthest from the camera (> 0).

remarks.para: The returned perspective transform is setup such that it can be used directly in OpenGL as the projection transform. The camera is positioned at the origin, looking towards the negative z-axis. The x-axis is pointing towards the right of the display, the y-axis points up.
This transformation matrix transforms coordinates within the viewing frustrum to a cube with coordinate ranges (-1, 1), which is convenient for clipping.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Transformation4F.GetOrthographicProjectionTransform(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the orthographic projection transform based on given viewing volume dimensions.
member.param: The x-coordinate of the left of the viewing volume.
The x-coordinate of the right the viewing volume.
The y-coordinate of the bottom the viewing volume.
The y-coordinate of the top the viewing volume.
The front clip plane z-value closest to the camera (> 0 if in front of camera).
The back clip plane z-value furthest from the camera (> 0 if in front of camera).

remarks.para: The returned orthographic transform is setup such that it can be used directly in OpenGL as the projection transform. The camera is positioned at the origin, looking towards the negative z-axis. The x-axis is pointing towards the right of the display, the y-axis points up.
This transformation matrix transforms coordinates within the viewing volume to a cube with coordinate ranges (-1, 1), which is convenient for clipping.

member.name: T:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2BR
member.summary: A 2D big rational based line consisting of a and a .
member.remarks:
The line is represented by x(t) = + t * where t may have any value.
If used as a shape the line is the representation of the parameter interval [0,1].

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2BR.Intersects(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2BR,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.Point2BR}@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Calculates if 2 lines intersect.
member.param: Resulting intersection if there is one, null otherwise.
If lines intersect, then this parameter indicates whether the lines are parallel. In this case parameter intersection contains no valid value.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2BR.GetIntersectionCoefficients(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2BR,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2BR,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.BigRational}@,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.BigRational}@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Calculate intersection parameters between two lines.
member.param: p, is null if there is no intersection or if the lines are parallel or if a has a zero direction.
q, is null if there is no intersection or if the lines are parallel or if b has a zero direction.
Whether the two lines are parallel.
member.returns: whether the two lines intersect.
member.remarks: The results is the solution of equation .Origin + p * .Direction = .Origin + q * .Direction.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2BR.Intersects(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2BR,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Segment2BR)
member.summary: Calculate intersection point between a line and a segment.

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2BR.GetIntersectionCoefficients(WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Line2BR,WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Segment2BR,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.BigRational}@,System.Nullable{WW.Math.Exact.BigRational}@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Calculate intersection point between a line and a segment.
member.param: p has value between 0 and 1 when there is 1 intersection. When the line and segment are parallel or if a has a zero direction, then p is set to null.
q has value between 0 and 1 when there is 1 intersection. When the line and segment are parallel or if b has a zero length, then q is set to null.
is set to true when the line and segment are parallel.
member.returns: whether the line and segment intersect.
member.remarks: The results is the solution of equation .Origin + p * .Direction = .Start + q * .GetDelta().

member.summary: Returns whether p is contained in the triangle specified by p0, p1, p2.
member.param: The on edge flags (only valid when return value is true): 0 is not on an edge, 1 is on the edge starting at p0, 2 is on the edge starting at p1, 4 is on the edge starting at p2.
member.remarks: The triangle points must be in clockwise order!

member.name: M:WW.Math.Exact.Geometry.Triangle2I.ContainsPoint(WW.Math.Exact.Point2I,WW.Math.Exact.Point2I,WW.Math.Exact.Point2I,WW.Math.Exact.Point2I,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns whether p is contained in the triangle specified by p0, p1, p2.
member.param: Index of edge to skip checking (e.g. if it was already checked elsewhere). Pass 0-2 to skip check a certain edge, or -1 to check all edges.
The on edge flags (only valid when return value is true): 0 is not on an edge, 1 is on the edge starting at p0, 2 is on the edge starting at p1, 4 is on the edge starting at p2.
Index of the edge (between 0 and 2) outside which the point is if the result is false, -1 otherwise.
member.returns: true if the specified p contains point; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The triangle points must be in clockwise order!
